page.title: 10CHANGING TIMES
page.content: THE BIGGEST CHANGE AROUND WHITSOME IS THAT THERE ARE FEWER PEOPLE NOW. THE FARMS USED TO EMPLOY MANY WORKERS. HORSES USED TO WORK THE FIELDS BUT WITH TRACTORS, MILKING MACHINES AND MICRO COMPUTER, ONE MAN CAN DO THE WORK OF MANY. THE SCHOOL HAD THREE TEACHERS AND OVER 100 PUPILS 80 YEARS AGO. NOW IT HAS ONE TEACHER AND NINE PUPILS AND IS THREATENED WITH CLOSURE. THE VILLAGE HAD NO ELECTRICITY OR PROPER DRAINAGE TILL 40 YEARS AGO. PARAFFIN LAMPS WERE USED AND WATER CAME FROM THE TWO VILLAGE WELLS. THERE WERE ONCE THREE JOINER'S SHOPS, A BLACKSMITH AND A PETROL PUMP. NOW ALL HAVE GONE. THERE ARE SOME NEW BUNGALOWS AND COUNCIL HOUSES BUT VERY FEW YOUNG PEOPLE LIVE HERE. MOST SERVICES AND AMENITIES ARE AT DUNS, CHIRNSIDE OR BERWICK. THERE ARE ONLY TWO BUSES A DAY SO PEOPLE USE CARS.
